p: In a previous study we successfully replaced all fish oil, in tilapia diets containing fishmeal, with a highly digestible, DHA-rich marine microalga, Schizochytrium sp. [ 33, 34]. Now, this paper presents research studying the replacement of fishmeal with a protein-rich and EPA-rich co-product (lipid-extracted) of another marine microalga, Nannochloropsis oculata ( N. oculata). Information about levels of nutrients and anti-nutrients and estimation of nutrient digestibility are the key steps to evaluate a new ingredient for growth of fish [ 35, 36]. In the present study, therefore, we determined levels of nutrients and anti-nutrients of dried whole cells of N. oculata and N. oculata co-product; digestibility of their nutrients for tilapia; and effects of different proportions of fishmeal replacement with N. oculata co-product on fish growth and flesh n3:n6 ratios that are beneficial for human health.
